document.title: CTE Model Curriculum Standards: Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation

16F697D7936843B58FB38E6B7167FDE2.description: Create a product describing the types of insurance, licenses, and permits needed for the operation and management of various popular outdoor activities.

A4FDE41C94E14561837275DE3FFD096A.description: Explore the departments, functions, and restrictions of public and private parks and recreational facilities and the outdoor recreational programs they offer.

24F946A0273D40EF960266193A623EA6.description: Evaluate the requirements of outdoor recreational businesses, including benefits, risks, required skills, and costs.

3605D9044DEB449E95A77624FFCD846D.description: Understand how the needs of various clients may be met through appropriate outdoor recreational activities, outdoor experiences, special tours, and environmentally responsible education.

9C2FC527F90240B6B4D0765A3A3F8441.description: Explain the outdoor recreational opportunities that promote physical and mental health.

C1F9C70657144DF38C0FEBFBA1FBD76D.description: Recognize the variety of parklands, wilderness areas, and waterways available for recreation.

A61E42071E704462A656B0776D6829E6.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the value of recreation and the fundamentals of recreational facilities and services.

24AB6DE2136C4065AB3EFAE19F78442C.description: Plan special events (e.g., meetings, trade shows, fairs, conferences) based on specific themes, budgets, agendas, space and security needs, and itineraries.

B324DEFBE9A945FC8FB36A7EEA982958.description: Develop schedules, registration tools, event materials, and programs.

E33F2997E53D400CBB529186297C0CC2.description: Demonstrate procedures for setting up facilities, equipment, and supplies.

A8BA0A2E7DEC4979A356025DBE9E1440.description: Understand how to establish business relationships with a variety of locations, food suppliers, and other vendors.

3C449497212D473ABE098EC9E51FF6CA.description: Demonstrate the essential procedures for planning, promoting, publicizing, coordinating, and evaluating a program or event.

1F9755B0A881498395BB11139AE7831E.description: Explain the purposes and target audiences of various venues.

57D3DEBC002C45D1988AF0FA93A8D258.description: Illustrate the fundamentals of planning events for a diverse clientele.

756F2465811D40C2815CFFCE91F86835.description: Compare the purposes, implications, and strategies of special promotions, such as season passes, multiple-day visits, retail items, and discount coupons.

BFB8EBFF8D49494B8B6B0BADDA5151D5.description: Analyze the ways in which the purposes of various industries; entertainment, education, and community relations affect their financial structure.

28B17F1BF81F435D9A47012F0696C2DF.description: Understand the internal hierarchy and departmental relationships of theme parks, attractions, or exhibitions.

B3A8E158A08B4BD2A8C2D1216CD22DFF.description: Understand how the various internal departments of theme parks, attractions, or exhibitions interrelate and support each other.

3B858203C95A4463A382B790E6E7B058.description: Explain the fundamental purpose and basic organizational structure of a variety of theme parks, attractions, and exhibitions.

6180F474C16343F69B5238C4F6A49753.description: Research the role and importance of online reservation services to marketing and profitability.

2A4F83C016BB4879BF9F08D585D40252.description: Understand the basic purpose, function, and operation of various travel systems and authorities, including the Airline Reporting Corporation, the Federal Aviation Administration, the major centralized reservation systems, and the Computerized Reservation System.

2BB595E3C5D64381B0A6A402B43E90C4.description: Classify the characteristics and configurations of common air and rail carriers, cruise ships, and attractions, including the most frequently used codes and terminology for ports of travel.

51FA09EB42DB466484113B807633F591.description: Evaluate important travel information, including insurance needs, vehicle rentals, passports, visas, and health documents, as well as how to plan specialty tour packages to fit client needs.

06033E792D854C61866329057F8EAF8D.description: Interpret the costs and other travel considerations involved in creating itineraries to meet client needs, including types of travel, types of fares, basic fare codes, costs, penalty charges, and types of accommodations.

15B322DEAAE043EBA0A1C3ED77A4FAFD.description: Apply the basic processes of making reservations, ticketing, and developing travel itineraries.

A0DB193DF2D9468490AC3DD8AFDFB1ED.description: Create a product using types of basic information that international travelers need, including physical geography, time zones, International Date Line, rights and responsibilities, laws, insurance, emergency services, and customs.

98BF785343E24A8D91615DC20EF19521.description: Understand fundamental ways in which physical geography, culture, and politics, affect local economies and world travel and tourism.

EE09E3CBC8804479B7F252BC70C67920.description: Interpret the basics of global and domestic physical and cultural geography in relation to the hospitality, tourism, and recreation industry.

58430F8DA44C4C159B2E4D222E082EBD.description: Compare the types of food service offered at various lodging facilities.

53213F0B9EFC4454B6923847E7210580.description: Understand the internal hierarchy and departmental interrelationships of lodging establishments.

7AEB6E71A0C945FAAD4B46FCE6765F15.description: Differentiate the required duties of various positions, including those of front desk and other service providers in relation to the functions of the business: checking guests in and out, greeting, assessing needs, delivering services, and closing the transaction.

4DF6383B649D42ADA6B1A8D0A2F405E5.description: Distinguish between the segments of the lodging industry, such as motels, limited service, full service resorts, all suites, extended-stay hotels, convention hotels, boutique hotels, and bed and breakfast facilities.

0C56B599155147C485AC1EB319A628CE.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the essential aspects of the lodging industry.

B1E859BD3D9F4684A4DACA8D1A841CCC.description: Produce a product that identifies and explains the impact of identity theft on the hospitality, tourism, and recreation industry.

BED685A8F36847949DB8ED342AA0A98A.description: Conduct all financial transactions in an accurate, professional, and ethical manner.

4DDF65B896F248AA9B4D7BFDB4A34438.description: Apply the procedures for handling noncash transactions: credit cards, debit cards, ATM cards, money orders, personal checks, coupons, discounts, and online transactions.

BF7E44DA651442569812200647066557.description: Apply procedures for handling cash transactions, such as balancing cash, handling cash control, converting currency, and identifying counterfeit currency.

AA1C0F394CEB4FF099954B744901C7B2.description: Implement procedures for common types of financial transactions.

3461C32E4BD64071AE590F83315C334B.description: Understand how essential departments in a hospitality, tourism, and recreation business contribute to economic success.

2E5F4BC3425E438CAC0B087D231C376F.description: Analyze work to be completed, prioritize tasks, and prepare a schedule to meet facility and personnel needs within an allotted budget.

96F01C5C79454D609AF40EFBDCFCB79A.description: Understand the relationship between facilities management and profit and loss, including the costs of resource consumption, breakage, theft, supplies use, and decisions for repairs or replacement.

58B84C0F77BC45C8BEA2F7A33309218E.description: Practice procedures for maintaining inventories, requisitioning equipment and tools, and storing and restocking supplies.

40C1405CCDBA42DB8B50E088303C6A2B.description: Recognize the types of materials and supplies used in the maintenance of facilities, including the identification of the hazardous properties of chemicals and the use of Material Safety Data Sheets (MSDS).

37C81B7552B94EFBA24B80243311667C.description: Apply the procedures for cleaning, maintaining, and repairing facilities and equipment and the importance of preventive maintenance.

58CAD6652A434A6A9913452BB445BC35.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the basics of systems operations and the importance of maintaining facilities, equipment, tools, and supplies.

95BA95A41FC747979BE224AB2979E2EB.description: Analyze the way in which basic marketing principles and procedures can be applied to targeting an audience, including: branding, bench marking, and promotional selling and upgrading and their effect on profits.

01856155024F4C8E825AA047D0B1D229.description: Analyze marketing strategies, including promotional selling and upgrading, and their effect on profits.

09BAD59C7AE54521AADA2B2E2CD74A13.description: Understand the value of advertising, public relations, social networking, and community involvement.

A01C9B12542D4536A8AA908B855673E8.description: Understand basic marketing principles for maximizing revenue based on supply and demand and competition.

74E310DA7AFA4FE1B205B2445D272344.description: Identify the major market segments of the hospitality, tourism, and recreation industry.

61A35FCF12584858AE471DF87463240E.description: Recognize ways of developing and maintaining long-term guest relationships.

3F55C0D3BBFF4124AFB5AE613F43098D.description: Describe the fundamentals of successful sales and marketing methods.

C0CF97028E8A4A82B297AD2F2B75E0C1.description: Interact with guests in a positive, responsive, and professional manner.

A922ED9AF1414777AD376F985560B8FD.description: Understand the roles of management and employees in effectively meeting the needs of culturally and generationally diverse guests and special needs customers.

F73685639C9F43679E8FA62299DB6EDB.description: Recognize common guest complaints and the service solutions for preventing or resolving them.

6DC169931FDC44AFBF8E9AB1C6BA6E16.description: Anticipate the needs, desires, and interests of guests in order to exceed their expectations by implementing total quality management practices (TQM).

BE8C8733E27849CD83A333660645723E.description: Demonstrate the concept of exceptional guest service.

0D7E854323334381B8E49B582ECC0925.description: Analyze the importance of guest services to the success of the industry.

D9B69A2D0CF94EFDB85773F5F77A4FD1.description: Apply the knowledge and skills essential for effective guest services in the hospitality, tourism, and recreation industry sector.

F0755087C4BF4EF8B1C75971646097DB.description: Create a product which explains the impact of main laws and regulations that affect accommodations and practices, including the requirements of the California Occupational Safety and Health Administration and the Americans with Disabilities Act, wage and hour laws, tenant status, and accommodation of minors.

7B5F3352E8DE4355A519F2DE69EBDC2E.description: Analyze the relationship of management techniques and appropriate business procedures, such as spreadsheets for payroll and inventories, tools for budgeting, recordkeeping, and corresponding to key outcomes: profitability, productivity, positive work environment, consumer and client satisfaction, business growth, business plans, corporate social responsibility, and environmental stewardship.

767BB674A5454801B70BB8E9BE060282.description: Explain common safety, security, and emergency policies and procedures used in the hospitality, tourism, and recreation industry to protect guests, visitors, and employees, such as safe work practices and conditions, confidentiality of customer information, control of keys, infectious disease control, first aid procedures, and emergency training.

E39744C1EB06468BAF7BF013136497C1.description: Understand the importance of specific human resource practices and procedures that address workplace diversity, harassment, personal safety, and discrimination.

18AB7498B1C548CBA118F5544106E71F.description: Interpret how the mission and goals of a business affect operations in the hospitality, tourism, and recreation industry.

6AC8790BD0684CDFA634C728DE0FE4F1.description: Analyze the basic elements of workforce and organizational management, including the roles and responsibilities of effective management and employees in the industry.

B7F28DE70FC64089BBF91FCCC4586698.description: Compare and contrast the relationship between industry trends and local, state, national, and international economic trends.

CFF6C6AB390942DC96379FB01A96D3EC.description: Analyze the impact and contributions of various segments of the industry on local, state, national, and international economies and cultures, and the environment.

7B12205E914A4A29AF2C9DB403FC4CE0.description: Analyze the working conditions of various careers in the hospitality, tourism, and recreation industry.

A40BF373A6C64CE395659AE302E9BC24.description: Define and compare core elements of the hospitality, tourism, and recreation industry from those of various supporting industries.

90B1248589034DDE8276C9175F3E4FAC.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the major aspects of the hospitality, tourism, and recreation industry (i.e. lodging, travel, and tourism; event planning; theme parks, attractions, and exhibitions; and recreation) and the industry's role in local, state, national, and global economies.

comments: The Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation pathway integrates various facets of the hospitality industry: lodging, travel, and tourism; event planning; theme parks, attractions, and exhibitions; and recreation. Students engaged in this pathway have broad experiences related to the specific industry segments, including: industry awareness; organizational management; customer service; sales and marketing; facilities management; lodging; travel destinations; and reservations, ticketing, and itineraries.

CA40A3E4DE61429E9F77AFEB918F8FDD.description: Design marketing strategies, including branding, benchmarking, and promotional selling and upgrading and their effect on profits.

F5694916EA314EFA980991AEA5729FB5.description: Research the various types of entrepreneurial opportunities in the food service industry.

98B7B17E1D01480C985FF5F8BE0C7BDF.description: Understand the value of advertising, public relations, social networking, and community involvement.

1F5C6223F03F451A8EE7F6417C0FCDC9.description: Understand basic marketing principles for maximizing revenue based on supply and demand and competition.

5169F0D08DE347CD80420F449D6E227B.description: Identify the major market segments of the industry and understand how marketing principles and procedures can be applied to target audiences.

072828F948294616879D32B1274FC395.description: Recognize methods to develop and maintain long-term customer relations.

0C22E8642A2D43C3965C0AF58A93EFE0.description: Describe the fundamentals of successful sales and marketing methods.

38900B51308B4DD38B4F4DDF8BA7C4F1.description: Calculate recipe costs and pricing per portion and compare the cost per cover to the theoretical cost.

E4192E83E68A4CC787D156EEC3C1A7E0.description: Evaluate the importance of the menu as the primary source of revenue generation and cost control.

521700987DCC489E8C2F791118FA581A.description: Understand the importance and structure of standardized systems, such as the Uniform System of Accounts for Restaurants.

BAF3B47CF4E4490EB6CEDB0E18AA9BCD.description: Utilize the practices of reduce, reuse, and recycle to maximize profits.

45C22163E6DE43D5829EEB3F058FA631.description: Understand the components of a profit and loss statement emphasizing food and labor costs.

4E5EBEFA538F442D91D4C8196AEBFF5B.description: Understand the customer's perception of value and its relationship to profit and loss.

41A688451F514539A1341B90EB965BAB.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the basic processes of costing and cost analysis in food and beverage production and service.

09004B0174F0450A8958A1FA6F661303.description: Create nutritious, creative, and profitable menus in accord with availability and demand.

E8402C72DFF94C0FA00CE938CD9E618E.description: Interpret nutritional or ingredient information from food labels and fact sheets and analyze menu items to meet the dietary needs of individuals.

D0118B34AAA3410AA7B4D766CCAF3DF5.description: Apply basic nutritional principles and know how to use food preparation techniques that conserve nutrients.

AE0E70483D414A81984B61942B95FD34.description: Demonstrate and apply basic nutritional concepts in meal planning and food preparation.

1A55A143E8224C478039FE2526CF4139.description: Produce a product that identifies and explains the impact of theft on the food service and hospitality industry.

7A07B2FDCD634B94A19C7113BD684397.description: Conduct all financial transactions in an accurate, professional, and ethical manner, including gratuities.

AE43C3EE7EA84C04AFBA9B8656A21FB5.description: Apply the procedures for handling noncash transactions including: credit cards, debit cards, ATM cards, money orders, personal checks, coupons, discounts, and online transactions.

9E5F8FEFB8F242948A3FEBBE54D3D3DC.description: Apply procedures for handling cash transactions, converting currency, and identifying counterfeit currency.

55965DAE89D841528710122088FFF0C1.description: Integrate appropriate, effective, and efficient techniques for writing food and beverage orders, relaying orders to the kitchen, coordinating and assembling food orders, and preparing and presenting checks to customers.

15DE961CC2E141F3A4FBF8A55F50A858.description: Practice proper techniques for customer service, including greeting, seating, presenting and explaining menu items, and taking customer orders.

A733845C3E0C43378736346CA5B853CA.description: Practice safe, efficient, and proper procedures for setting, serving, maintaining, and busing tables.

1A59C1AD785F4ECEA6CDF70E30DC94EB.description: Apply the concept of mise en place in relation to food and beverage service.

1338AFDCED3944D7BAECB04900432AE8.description: Differentiate the required duties of various positions, including those of the host/hostess, wait staff, bus person, and others related to opening, closing, change-of-shift, and preparatory work.

28F61CDAC8094102B1707D70EA33F7CC.description: Apply the basic procedures and skills needed for food and beverage service.

98D1A8C57D9A4DAF83E51843553442FB.description: Interact with customers in a positive, responsive, and professional manner.

D1CD9C5F9FDD443291C130C383549A4C.description: Understand the roles of management and employees in effectively meeting the needs of culturally, generationally diverse, special needs customers.

AD158BEBF5014F42A801C5477997EC58.description: Recognize common customer complaints and the service solutions for preventing or resolving complaints.

5E42ABA88FF841AA8C520435FB5A2E91.description: Demonstrate the concept of exceptional customer service and know ways of anticipating the needs and desires of customers to exceed their expectations.

FC2350C0B3B84C08AD3DAD4EC4745787.description: Analyze the importance of customer service to the success of the food service establishment.

60BBF225BC7247FD86F6F2203EA195AD.description: Apply the knowledge and skills essential for effective customer service.

BD4A339B183F4211A1F87E48546665A2.description: Develop a plan using forecasting and cross-utilization of products to maximize profit and eliminate waste.

21072C2C158E49CEA8552BE7DCF6C569.description: Understand packaging and merchandising techniques to feature seasonal and standard bakery products.

7532C9DA42C04E8DB48C57F766490818.description: Evaluate the qualities and properties of food items and ingredients used for baked goods, pastries, and desserts.

46ED7A27897449CDBE1B8A5BB3DDF5A4.description: Produce baked goods, pastries, and desserts by using the correct terminology, food safety, techniques, procedures, and various finishing techniques.

5A04BE5B8EA1426F9962949D27C3D6F5.description: Apply the principle of mise en place, including the placement and order of use of the ingredients, equipment, tools, and supplies unique to baking and pastry production.

B194B0D3EEE044C5BA898A16918D79BB.description: Use, maintain, and store the tools, utensils, equipment, and appliances safely and appropriately for preparing, serving, and storing baked goods, pastries, and desserts.

B90C32C5B6E7400C8A0723C9E69E279A.description: Illustrate and apply the basics of baking, pastry, and dessert preparation and safety and sanitation in professional and institutional kitchens.

00C1C6723D954592A6D2C9EE99DBF083.description: Develop a food preparation plan using forecasting and cross-utilization of products to maximize profit and eliminate waste.

78ACB520CBBC4DB5AC5D7E49FF34095A.description: Design plating techniques, including accurate portioning and aesthetic presentation skills.

68518E35077147609AC314FAB9DE905E.description: Evaluate the qualities and properties of food items and ingredients used in food preparation.

19FBA1ED7BD94996A8BE8C7938AC3135.description: Plan and follow a food production schedule, including timing and prioritizing of tasks and activities.

92F75E8C51D443ED9124DA92F9892117.description: Prepare food by using the correct terminology, food safety, techniques, and procedures specified in recipes and formulas.

C89AB6900BCA4FEB92E3592DFC500821.description: Apply the principle of mise en place, including the placement and order of use of ingredients, equipment, tools, and supplies.

0EB5281AD0EE4F1C87441A23F86C7535.description: Use, maintain, and store the tools, utensils, equipment, and appliances safely and appropriately for preparing a variety of food items.

7B73129A12354AF99733798AD7AFDCA0.description: Illustrate and apply the basics of food preparation and safety and sanitation in professional and institutional kitchens.

7F51529FAD9443ECB52E9CB288E6A228.description: Prioritize tasks and plan work schedules based on budget and personnel.

FEA177DB81CF4AAFA9C4E55AF0CAF658.description: Understand how various departments in a food service facility contribute to the economic success of a business.

6D3851EBC41C4385B237CD6DB0C4AF34.description: Understand the relationship between facilities management and profit and loss, including the costs of resource consumption, breakage, theft, supplies use, and decisions for repairs or replacement.

5CB2F60B921C46BE80CB0CA23858D42B.description: Practice the procedures for maintaining inventories: ordering food, equipment, and supplies; and storing and restocking supplies.

B54DAA1EFDF040AB924E1FC409939FAD.description: Recognize the types of materials and supplies used in the maintenance of facilities, including the identification of the hazardous environmental and physical properties of chemicals and the use of Material Safety Data Sheets (MSDS).

C89C7176B3324305B187D16E34EA6305.description: Apply the procedures for cleaning and maintaining facilities and equipment and the importance of preventive maintenance and the use of nontoxic and less toxic materials.

A75095F472C34B78A39C83151A595ED5.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the basics of systems operations and the importance of maintaining facilities, equipment, tools, and supplies.

0E3A72ECFC364507AA0BB388CFB835D3.description: Design and interpret business plans including: the mission, vision, target market, location, financing, and the community and ecological context of the business.

98AD4517897D43AABFAA025E1FB74B2C.description: Understand the relationship of effective management and business procedures to important outcomes, such as profitability, productivity, workplace atmosphere, consumer and guest satisfaction, and business growth.

ED59B496ADC44F8097788DE322189EE1.description: Interpret the differences in goals and organizational management of various food service businesses.

7340FD31B66145ECAA74531D4B4197BD.description: Understand the importance of specific human resource practices and procedures that address workplace diversity, harassment, personal safety, and discrimination.

788B79750AA0435CA92D0B6F8CFA6FBB.description: Understand the responsibilities of management, such as ensuring safe work practices and conditions and complying with important laws and regulations that affect employment, such as wage and hour laws, tenant status, and accommodation of minors.

5F27015161DE425CBD37E7262EF4252E.description: Analyze the basics of food service and hospitality management.

96BBF852C8CD4F0BA4E359F7A0ECA6DC.description: Understand the purpose and process of required industry certification (e.g., ServSafe, California Food Handlers Card).

B6570A9760D045658533E036559D6F3A.description: Understand the essential principles of Hazard Analysis Critical Control Points, including the use of flowcharts.

969E54492B914E03A8A898E7A4293F10.description: Practice safe and sanitary procedures in all food handling, including food receiving, storage, production, service, and cleanup.

F12B33AD157E4B948C80283BC4911A9B.description: Explain the types of food contamination, the potential causes, including cross-contamination, and methods of prevention.

B9BCC69B2AF548A685284DBB93CE3C4E.description: Understand basic local, state, and federal sanitation regulations as they pertain to food production and service.

69822DF5CA784DA38DBDDCB836228C8E.description: Employ the standards of personal grooming and hygiene required by local, state, and federal health and safety codes.

8516B318E6D64674A91EB4D95B1B0592.description: Interpret the basic principles of sanitation and safe food handling.

A923EDE32E8041B8B90B0E93657C74FB.description: Understand the source and purpose of information in the Material Safety Data Sheets (MSDS) and know the proper use of personal protective equipment (PPE).

73AC1393ED7B4E90BBDCA7AFE7DFA1B6.description: Understand the role of the California Occupational Safety and Health Administration, the Environmental Protection Agency, and other agencies in regulating practices in the food service and hospitality industry.

2CEEA040C61B4830B39DEC313956BD4C.description: Practice the basic procedures for the safety of employees and guests, including the procedures for emergency situations.

5A81A67DB03545DE8F332D2445369662.description: Identify the causes, prevention, and treatment of common accidents and the reporting procedures involved.

E882FA399D4645839FA2B7B2368D700F.description: Demonstrate the basics of safe work habits, security, and emergency procedures required in food service and hospitality establishments.

74FAA15BDFB34675AA1025B480BBEE74.description: Research the advantages and disadvantages of the working conditions of various careers in the food service and hospitality industry.

2422B8831C5D4F2B9C072D43385CB519.description: Explain the relationship between industry trends and local, state, national, and international economic trends.

FD91EF3505824A21BFE704EEBC006DE1.description: Understand how the various segments of the industry contribute to, and impact, local, state, national, and international economies, cultures, and the environment.

E0FB9EBC6848490E82E9270FE55A7010.description: Define and compare core elements of the food service and hospitality industry from various supporting industries.

1FD3D882E1654C13A043ECED7861295B.description: Demonstrate an understanding of major aspects of the food service and hospitality industry and the role of the industry in local, state, national, and global economies.

comments: The Food Service and Hospitality pathway focuses on the key aspects of the industry. Students pursuing this career pathway have in-depth, hands-on experiences that emphasize industry awareness; sanitation and safe food handling; food and beverage production; nutrition; food service management; and customer service.

EAD3CD768653476592C3114871E69575.description: Compare and contrast the influence of consumer trends and expectations on product development and marketing.

00B49475A7CD45E884DC1EAE272018A4.description: Explain the use of technical reports in preparing and disseminating information.

B74535BAFD9E475A8D8BFBC004965642.description: Evaluate the psychological effects of market branding, subliminal messages, and advertising on consumer choices.

B87A0EFB92384BE4BFCB38A9AB3CDB2C.description: Understand the methods and importance of communicating accurate information to consumers about nutrition, food safety, and food products.

656D696490774F5B948B36CCD79F4260.description: Explain the differences between public relations, advertising, and provision of accurate information to consumers.

7F968FA71BBF4E88A65A970B43BDF042.description: Describe the fundamental concepts of marketing and public relations used in the dissemination of information about food science, dietetics, and nutrition.

7F060F80EA114ECC83CD812F523F3669.description: Create a product that explores global, logistical, ecological, and economic impacts of food production and packaging methods, including genetic engineering.

6C7B2C64346D431B8950AE0BD7534FBF.description: Test food products by using controls, variables, and random sampling.

3F367E77BCDA45C29DC453F919B4CEB3.description: Prepare and test formulas for developing new food products.

BE8E6040FB10432ABD260CD2E5BCE4AC.description: Analyze research implications on food trends, value-added processing, genetic engineering, and irradiation.

BC0ECDA99483458C83E4A0DDBBFD01B7.description: Explain quality control, assurance standards, and the procedures for each used in research and development.

4D0DF32166DC447CA45700796EBD86B5.description: Understand the purpose, importance, and basic procedures of sensory evaluation experiments.

290BA1BE47194337909B879089541AD3.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the basic principles of research and development, food analysis, and sensory evaluation in the field of food science and technology.

8A59AC756AF6409FAD1A22BA1CEBE86F.description: Document experiments and maintain laboratory records.

080F1BEA6566463C9364B61ECEA57BDD.description: Conduct scientific experiments using the scientific method.

273CD8706656491986344202F7822880.description: Understand important chemical and physical changes that occur during food preparation.

414812A95DBF4DDE890158BD827D6AC1.description: Practice safe laboratory and equipment use and maintenance procedures.

33171659D8E9448BAF053A92475BDD01.description: Recognize terminology, methods, and equipment used in the food science and technology industry.

AD97584EA72C4CB2A6492CA35E3FC384.description: Interpret the basic principles of chemistry and physics related to changes in foods and food products during preparation, processing, and preservation.

A00FF53048A44B8B87ABC26F8699CDAF.description: Explain the training needs of an effective food service outreach staff.

F4B8A7C2788343FEA174E7D4AF364B16.description: Summarize the factors that affect the management and operation of a food service outreach program.

F5F647A6DF794CF98B43F12D58DC3CA8.description: Identify the types of community-based and institutional programs that provide food and nutrition outreach services.

346C447C133F43BAA3B16AA8BA815437.description: Explain the basic principles of managing and operating food service outreach programs.

26DD502D426F4115AE4EEABC96130057.description: Provide examples of the influence of cultural health-related practices and food preferences on the nutrition, fitness, and wellness of individuals.

1AF6585838D04EA989355A9C8F7220D7.description: Understand the differences in services and outreach methods of community organizations that provide nutrition, fitness, and wellness information and services.

C957C16FDA4740679D6C3A2B020F5D0D.description: Classify the available community services, agencies, and outreach programs that provide nutrition, fitness, and wellness information and services.

05CC614C21364FA4BEED3F4A1E2A31BD.description: Identify the basics of community collaborative opportunities and methods of outreach in the field of nutrition, fitness, and wellness.

908A6DD829094F74ABB1D2800B58322D.description: Provide examples of how social and cultural norms and barriers relate to the implementation of nutrition, fitness, and wellness changes.

3330E165B049417D9FA0BCFC45877B20.description: Analyze nutrient density as it relates to food quality and dietary choices for individual nutrition, fitness, and wellness goals.

D593A20A5E94411DB52490C6FD910933.description: Analyze popular diets for recommendations that are consistent with, or contrary to, approved dietary guidelines.

4ACEC25408AA41E396980D4C6C113514.description: Interpret nutritional information needed to implement and sustain change in behavior and lifestyle management.

EBEE63DAC1654375A892012CADFC7BC5.description: Explain how research-based, recognized dietary guidelines relate to nutrition, fitness, and overall wellness.

9785F0CFEC4C403AA4EDD266B0E299EA.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the correlation of food and fitness to wellness.

2696BD837F3C479E8CF7F1C7DEC4DF7A.description: Formulate recommended diets for different dietary and health needs.

2F4D8C7D33964FB89003CB5D3C3126B9.description: Illustrate the anatomical structure and functions of the digestive system, including the biochemical processes involved in digestion, absorption, metabolism, energy balance, and food-drug interactions.

EB4C61A09B1B48F49D5B0E35E1796902.description: Analyze appropriate nutrient intake, diet, and energy expenditure for individuals of different ages and with different dietary and health needs.

C7AC205F435840DFA59D8A862304B894.description: Understand the relationship of emotional, psychological, and physiological needs to food intake and natural hunger cues.

D0C45B5618DC4CD1AF5E3D087A72193C.description: Recognize the relationship of basic nutritional principles and concepts to the physical and emotional well-being of individuals.

1AAC0799ACB547E2BE40BF53E990E3E2.description: Produce a product that integrates the use of procedures for preventing the spread of food-borne pathogens and illness, allergens, cross-contacts, and contaminants.

77AE2B7A89884C03B79FD580135ECFD6.description: Interpret safe and sanitary food-handling procedures as set forth by local, state, and federal health and safety codes, including reporting and dealing with violations of the food safety code.

3A7B7F0812254291B06F251C2EBA82F5.description: Practice industry-recommended standards for personal grooming and hygiene.

32C0CD7DABDD4D0A9220B89D224ECA1D.description: Demonstrate the application of primary standards and regulations for safe food handling and sanitation practices.

EDB76A48B9594423BF34BFA02D4964D7.description: Evaluate important management strategies for planning, decision making, shared responsibility, and negotiations.

D101840AA55B4FE7B7E686DA514C0D7E.description: Explain the differences and importance of the main elements in day-to-day operational procedures at various types of food-related facilities.

15B51C665BBD4190A5C986021C10ACA8.description: Find information on the primary business procedures for food science, dietetics, and nutrition organizations.

71F81E1A65C847359B1CEDCDBD482B38.description: Identify important workforce and organizational management concepts.

5DEBA30FBEAA44ED81121FF8E8C27EAD.description: Create a product depicting the different requirements and standards for employees in the industry, including education, training, licensures, and certifications.

5F8BB113CA17477BA718AD86762DFA81.description: Evaluate the contributions of the various segments of the industry to local, state, national, and international economies.

BF53128CAB364C088AF42316D3FC341E.description: Define and compare core elements of the food science, dietetics, and nutrition industry from the supporting industries and regulatory agencies.

23658790797A4CBAB2F5651F5424FE84.description: Demonstrate an understanding of key aspects of the food science, dietetics, and nutrition industry and the role of the industry in the local, state, national, and global economies.

comments: The Food Science, Dietetics, and Nutrition pathway focuses on three specializations centered on the science of food and its relationship to the health and well-being of individuals. Students pursuing this career pathway learn about industry awareness; food safety and sanitation; workforce and organizational management; food, fitness, and wellness; nutritional requirements and processes; food chemistry and technology; research and product development; and marketing and public relations.

3B7CD5CE45AF4F91AE3783ECAD7DC627.description: Create a portfolio, or similar collection of work, that offers evidence through assessment and evaluation of skills and knowledge competency as contained in the anchor standards, pathway standards, and performance indicators.

A0C890F339B7407C9FB49B69346C3EDC.description: Employ entrepreneurial practices and behaviors appropriate to Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation sector opportunities.

C739BB28AD584C5582BEF11100851B68.description: Demonstrate entrepreneurship skills and knowledge of self-employment options and innovative ventures.

3DD809AA796F4286BE0BE4A073623485.description: Demonstrate proficiency in a career technical pathway that leads to certification, licensure, and/or continued learning at the postsecondary level.

377EEC5A6C66474197E3F20BDDD5D673.description: Utilize work-based/workplace learning experiences to demonstrate and expand upon knowledge and skills gained during classroom instruction and laboratory practices specific to the Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation sector program of study.

comments: Demonstrate and apply the knowledge and skills contained in the Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation anchor standards, pathway standards, and performance indicators in classroom, laboratory and workplace settings, and through the career technical student organization (FHA-HERO, the California Affiliate of FCCLA).

44FE51EBCE9C4E83B3D9FAE19A1AA549.description: Demonstrate an understanding of how knowledge, skills, attitudes, and behaviors learned in Consumer and Family Studies can be transferred to advanced education and training or careers in Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation.

F952FBA57A0A43A1963218CB21517704.description: Explain how individuals apply strategies that enable them to manage personal, family, and work responsibilities to enhance productivity.

B9EBCEF3495244C99202B3CE3B6A108E.description: Assess the individual, family, and workplace factors that influence decisions related to health, leisure, and recreation at each stage of the life cycle and quality of life.

344199612EC242C7AA588C5ADE6EC343.description: Explain how to select, safely use, and efficiently care for facilities and equipment related to food product development, food preparation, dining, lodging, tourism, and recreation.

CD7D578CA220434D82D8F7B8C77FC397.description: Describe food production, processing, and distribution methods and the relationship of those techniques to consumer food supply and nutrition.

A85F69C9B9444A639263682A0D883896.description: Identify the aspects of science related to food preparation, product development, and nutrition.

DADAC30618AA41CFB0F332C70623C545.description: Describe commonly accepted food customs as well as table setting, meal service, and etiquette practices of the United States and other cultures.

634195B764C8451281BC448EE3E4A68A.description: Apply the principles of food purchasing, food preparation, and meal management in a variety of settings.

F805AD82BB964DF39128F668751151EA.description: Define and identify the basic principles of food safety and sanitation and the proper techniques for preparing and serving food.

B37EC94B0BDF48698666E0B0777E89D6.description: Define the principles of nutrition and their relationship to good health through the life cycle.

2C835352C9B748AF86438497E654CE21.description: Collaborate with industry experts for specific technical knowledge and skills.

C597EA48D6C342859D464484CC2FC615.description: Construct projects and products specific to the Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation sector requirements and expectations.

E66A799B0F944D4A8F4EC2FBD926DD06.description: Comply with the rules, regulations, and expectations of all aspects of the Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation sector.

C2A85E08B3F34BC69AA5484FA58AE599.description: Interpret and explain terminology and practices specific to the Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation sector.

comments: Apply essential technical knowledge and skills common to all pathways in the Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation sector, following procedures when carrying out experiments or performing technical tasks.

26F86C262A3F487B8957028B16B024B6.description: Participate in interactive teamwork to solve real Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation sector issues and problems.

52C8F1B6204D44BBBCF634A1560D345C.description: Respect individual and cultural differences and recognize the importance of diversity in the workplace.

8511052C451A4D1AB457693B9FC3DA4A.description: Understand that the modern world is an international community and requires an expanded global view.

2F4D588D378E45D5A48CD7FCD892E0ED.description: Explain how professional associations and organizations (such as FHA-HERO) and associated leadership development and competitive career development activities enhance academic preparation, promote career choices, and contribute to employment opportunities.

51AEF2D6161F4683895F7BF0A87FBD6C.description: Understand the characteristics and benefits of teamwork, leadership, and citizenship in the school, community, and workplace setting.

33ECC1D60DE74113B1AA37FF3F8987A4.description: Identify the characteristics of successful teams, including leadership, cooperation, collaboration, and effective decision-making skills as applied in groups, teams, and career technical student organization activities.

83A92B5D48DC4FC38DEAE914D5D6C685.description: Define leadership and identify the responsibilities, competencies, and behaviors of successful leaders.

comments: Work with peers to promote divergent and creative perspectives, effective leadership, group dynamics, team and individual decision making, benefits of workforce diversity, and conflict resolution as practiced in the career technical student organization (FHA-HERO, the California Affiliate of FCCLA).

0E4969B9CE8244EAB0BF76FC58694862.description: Conform to rules and regulations regarding sharing of confidential information, as determined by Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation sector laws and practices.

25B7699AFD314EBBB534606AAF37661C.description: Adhere to copyright and intellectual property laws and regulations, and use and appropriately cite proprietary information.

1ACA18B47A23477D97DA54C2F243776D.description: Analyze organizational culture and practices within the workplace environment.

9BAFF582F2E6421F8E6597D018DC4E9D.description: Explain the importance of personal integrity, confidentiality, and ethical behavior in the workplace.

3FF10A4E32FC41D4BABC7AE310BE755B.description: Demonstrate ethical and legal practices consistent with Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation sector workplace standards.

BB2563EB810E486F905A15DF30F5C4C9.description: Identify local, district, state, and federal regulatory agencies, entities, laws, and regulations related to the Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation industry sector.

573E7C5319BF4755B4B6D85B60EB72A3.description: Access, analyze, and implement quality assurance standards of practice.

comments: Practice professional, ethical, and legal behavior, responding thoughtfully to diverse perspectives and resolving contradictions when possible, consistent with applicable laws, regulations, and organizational norms.

7CCB9A136AE64275830F8C2368C29573.description: Explore issues of global significance and document the impact on the Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation sector.

3D320A33F4F54646AD3FDDF152C70647.description: Demonstrate the qualities and behaviors that constitute a positive and professional work demeanor, including appropriate attire for the profession.

0D2FFFB6AD864F5FBE7A569CAF4E3325.description: Demonstrate knowledge and practice of responsible financial management.

F3EC4EF18D9E4F6A8B6195EE1FB0FE0F.description: Apply high-quality techniques to product or presentation design and development.

918ACA4889E54A58B33BB1854FA39C31.description: Practice time management and efficiency to fulfill responsibilities.

1D4E66F1192640669C4CD015B3EA44CF.description: Understand the need to adapt to changing and varied roles and responsibilities.

FB75ABE66303498E876AA058579427F3.description: Explain the importance of accountability and responsibility in fulfilling personal, community, and workplace roles.

F33D4914145A43E4BA2F948CFDDDBE33.description: Recognize how financial management impacts the economy, workforce, and community.

comments: Initiate, and participate in, a range of collaborations demonstrating behaviors that reflect personal and professional responsibility, flexibility, and respect in the Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation sector workplace environment and community settings.

C4B49667997D45AEB617AC539A821447.description: Be informed of laws/acts pertaining to the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA).

0D77AB925B654FB5B9671E404FC02D22.description: Maintain a safe and healthful working environment.

560CBB53DB9D4B0A8D731B39B4AAE441.description: Demonstrate how to prevent and respond to work-related accidents or injuries; this includes demonstrating an understanding of ergonomics.

BF42A55DD4484DCBBF3BA2FABEBCFBDC.description: Practice personal safety when lifting, bending, or moving equipment and supplies.

C6A13EF2485B40FD9EA2E60BADA3C255.description: Use health and safety practices for storing, cleaning, and maintaining tools, equipment, and supplies.

AD84D63E3D9E48CAA41563C4B05DD5B5.description: Interpret policies, procedures, and regulations for the workplace environment, including employer and employee responsibilities.

9D992A9B52E44C4283C0D86AD61CC7DA.description: Locate, and adhere to, Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS) instructions.

comments: Demonstrate health and safety procedures, regulations, and personal health practices and determine the meaning of symbols, key terms, and domain-specific words and phrases as related to the Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation sector workplace environment.

CC11E2B5837744E1860C76E788C5DBD2.description: Interpret information and draw conclusions, based on the best analysis, to make informed decisions.

8F7139F356DC404399A539D2C251ADA6.description: Use systems thinking to analyze how various components interact with each other to produce outcomes in a complex work environment.

E08434F327BA4E6088EBEEE99B3A678B.description: Solve predictable and unpredictable work-related problems using various types of reasoning (inductive, deductive) as appropriate.

9940E978FBE14A5A88A12C5E86FD485B.description: Identify and ask significant questions that clarify various points of view to solve problems.

comments: Conduct short, as well as more sustained, research to create alternative solutions to answer a question or solve a problem unique to the Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation, using critical and creative thinking; logical reasoning, analysis, inquiry, and problem-solving techniques.

6585AA55A7DC44E08E896BCDC0AC98B8.description: Assess the value of various information and communication technologies to interact with constituent populations as part of a search of the current literature or in relation to the information task.

485ABBBC56664CA9B74765DEF563760D.description: Research past, present, and projected technological advances as they impact a particular pathway.

11EB92D5282D41F48B6129624A65D407.description: Discern the quality and value of information collected using digital technologies, and recognize bias and intent of the associated sources.

4B778D0D7EFE4E17A567257EA394BD9F.description: Use information and communication technologies to synthesize, summarize, compare, and contrast information from multiple sources.

2CA7A09A5FDE40AD9716887DE49D800B.description: Employ Web-based communications responsibly and effectively to explore complex systems and issues.

7380A8C51E6C43DC9FA1412C1E9E037E.description: Use electronic reference materials to gather information and produce products and services.

comments: Use existing and emerging technology, to investigate, research, and produce products and services, including new information, as required in the Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation sector workplace environment.

3EF2429627A24E7EBCD9E2BE7EAECCDE.description: Develop a career plan that reflects career interests, pathways, and postsecondary options.

53B4449890344CFB9DF3FBC39F799944.description: Understand how digital media are used by potential employers and postsecondary agencies to evaluate candidates.

C100909C129847E392783F9B248A6362.description: Recognize the importance of small business in the California and global economies.

3AC2CDF48BF343E1A2B92B61EAB01F17.description: Recognize the role and function of professional organizations, industry associations, and organized labor in a productive society.

6666EBC4BDC34BCFB5A6DC052C0934D5.description: Integrate changing employment trends, societal needs, and economic conditions into career planning.

7CCCA298E18A454ABADE64BA0B06A891.description: Research the scope of career opportunities available and the requirements for education, training, certification, and licensure.

2B5C0925732C49B2B1611637DD8E687D.description: Explore how information and communication technologies are used in career planning and decision making.

44C73C4C3BB44346B0948BBA757ABB80.description: Evaluate personal character traits such as trust, respect, and responsibility and understand the impact they can have on career success.

54D76B3FA3E74DB1BEA3773ACB8C2BB1.description: Identify personal interests, aptitudes, information, and skills necessary for informed career decision making.

comments: Integrate multiple sources of career information from diverse formats to make informed career decisions, solve problems, and manage personal career plans.

7C19A6F94CF34D16B982EA40CA709BFC.description: Advocate and practice safe, legal, and responsible use of digital media information and communications technologies.

0C0923912C2549E08927D925077DF952.description: Communicate information and ideas effectively to multiple audiences using a variety of media and formats.

9269E355FE2C4A299AF6E7D30B1E64E6.description: Demonstrate elements of written and electronic communication such as accurate spelling, grammar, and format.

98935F6426974BA5BD7BA78F4FE56A7B.description: Interpret verbal and nonverbal communications and respond appropriately.

BAD35C53BC0047E080461C4CDABE9E8C.description: Identify barriers to accurate and appropriate communication.

09B0CA99D0944463A573DD1ACE623382.description: Recognize the elements of communication using a senderreceiver model.

comments: Acquire and accurately use Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation sector terminology and protocols at the career and college readiness level for communicating effectively in oral, written, and multimedia formats.

Analyze and apply appropriate academic standards required for successful industry sector pathway completion leading to postsecondary education and employment. Refer to the Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation academic alignment matrix for identification of standards.
